interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Sweet Dreams (DVD)
Review Date: 2018/07/24
Store: Ed Harris  (Actor),     Jessica Lange  (Actor),     Karel Reisz  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, HBO, All HBO Titles
Product Description: ['Sweet Dreams (DVD)', 'She was the first female solo artist to be elected to the Country Music Hall of Fame. Thirty-two years after her untimely death in a plane crash in Tennessee, Patsy Cline\'s "Greatest Hits" album sold over six million copies. Loved by her fans today as much - if not more-than she was at the height of her fame, the life, the loves and most of all the voice of Patsy Cline is legendary. SWEET DREAMS tells her story. Marrying the unique singing voice of Patsy Cline, with a powerhouse performance by Jessica Lange, director Karel Reisz creates an extraordinary portrait of the passionate, fun-loving, soft-spoken, loud-living life and times of one of country\'s - and one of popular music\'s greatest singing stars. Covering the years 1956through 1963, from her rise to fame and the top of the charts through TV talent shows and country bars; through her turbulent marriage to Charlie Dick and the demands of touring which would lead to the fatal plane crash, this remarkable story is one that will be treasured by fans old and new. A celebration of the talent we love, and the story of Patsy Cline.', ']]>']
Average Rating: 4.8

So happy to have this in my DVD collection!  A great movie. This movie came out when I was a young girl and had forgotten just how wonderful it was and how it effected my life then, even at such a young age and now at this age, also. Reminding me in a strong way of how faith in God can grow and bring joy back into this old woman's heart.

And Now Tomorrow
Alan Ladd, Loretta Young, Susan Hayward  (Actor),     Irving Pichel  (Director)    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure
["Alan Ladd, Loretta Young and Susan Hayward star in this powerful love story And Now Tomorrow about one woman's extraordinary struggle over adversity. Emily Blair (Young) seems to have it all: money, prestige and independence. However, when her sense of hearing fades, her only hope lies with the young and determined Dr. Marek Vance (Ladd). As they search for a cure to her condition, hope gives way to unexpected romance in this screenplay co-written by famed detective novelist Raymond Chandler and featuring stunning costumes by Edith Head."]

I Saw the Light
Tom Hiddleston  (Actor),     Elizabeth Olsen  (Actor),     Marc Abraham  (Director, Producer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
['Product Description', 'I SAW THE LIGHT is the story of the legendary country western singer Hank Williams (Tom Hiddleston), who in his brief life created one of the greatest bodies of work in American music. The film chronicles his meteoric rise to fame and its ultimately tragic effect on his health and personal life. Also starring Elizabeth Olsen, Cherry Jones, Bradley Whitford, Maddie Hasson and Wrenn Schmidt.', 'Review', 'I SAW THE LIGHT is the story of the legendary country western singer Hank Williams (Tom Hiddleston), who in his brief life created one of the greatest bodies of work in American music. The film chronicles his meteoric rise to fame and its ultimately tragic effect on his health and personal life. Also starring Elizabeth Olsen, Bradley Whitford, David Krumholtz and Cherry Jones.']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary**

- **Media Preferences**: The user remains drawn to films that explore serious themes and personal growth, emphasizing narratives filled with warmth, community, and emotional depth.

- **Rating Tendencies**: While the user typically rates films around 4 stars, their recent experience with a particular title, which led to a 1-star rating, reflects an increasing critical engagement. This shift indicates that they may have heightened expectations for authenticity and quality, particularly regarding narrative execution.

- **Emotional Engagement**: Their connection to character arcs and emotional narratives continues, but the recent critique reveals a greater scrutiny of how these elements are presented, signaling a need for more satisfactory portrayal of complexities within human experiences.

- **Educational Value**: The user seeks films that illuminate social issues and stimulate thought. Their latest review underscores frustration when a film fails to deliver on these educational aspects or lacks sincerity in its storytelling.

- **Subject Matter Interest**: The user still appreciates biographical stories showcasing resilience and community; however, their latest interaction indicates a crucial need for authentic representation in these narratives.

- **Constructive Critique**: Their feedback maintains a balanced approach, though the recent negative review portrays a stronger critique when films fall short of emotional or narrative authenticity.

Overall, the user aspires for impactful cinema that not only provides educational insights but also meets their heightened expectations for quality storytelling and genuine emotional engagement.
